intro: Strombocarpa odorata, commonly known as the fragrant strombocarp, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
